metadata.title: Decision Tree Template
metadata.description: This is a generic schema for creating decision tree conversations. Replace this with a description of your specific decision tree.
metadata.author: your_name_here
metadata.documentation: This schema defines the structure for a decision tree conversation. The conversation_flow array contains nodes that define questions, options, and navigation paths. The conversation_history array will store the actual conversation as it happens.

conversation_flow.question: This is your first question. It should be engaging and set the direction for the conversation.
conversation_flow.documentation: This is the root node where all conversations start. The node_id must be 'root' for the first question.

conversation_flow.question: This is a follow-up question for the first option.
conversation_flow.documentation: This node is reached when the user selects the first option from the root question.

conversation_flow.question: This is a follow-up question for the second option.
conversation_flow.documentation: This node is reached when the user selects the second option from the root question.

conversation_flow.question: This is a follow-up question for the third option.
conversation_flow.documentation: This node is reached when the user selects the third option from the root question.

conversation_flow.question: This is a follow-up for free-text responses.
conversation_flow.documentation: This node is reached when the user provides a custom response rather than selecting one of the predefined options.

node_types.multiple_choice: Presents numbered options to the user. The user can select an option by number or type a free-text response.
node_types.open: Accepts any free-text response from the user. No options are presented.

required_fields.node_id: A unique identifier for the node. The first node must have the ID 'root'.
required_fields.question: The text that will be displayed to the user.
required_fields.options: Required for multiple_choice nodes. An array of option objects.
required_fields.default_next_node: The node to navigate to if the user provides a free-text response or if the response doesn't match any option.

option_fields.option_id: A unique identifier for the option within this node. Typically a number as a string.
option_fields.text: The text that will be displayed to the user for this option.
option_fields.next_node: The node_id to navigate to if this option is selected.

best_practices: Provide 2-5 options for multiple choice questions
Always include an 'Other' option for multiple choice questions
Make sure all node_ids referenced in next_node fields actually exist
Consider the conversation flow carefully to avoid dead ends
Test your decision tree thoroughly before deploying
